tweet:
I’m supporting the effort to expand national service programs so we can:
✅Double the service positions available to 150K in year one

✅Expand partnerships between @AmeriCorps & @CDCgov 

✅Increase volunteer incentives so more Americans can serve and stop the spread of COVID-19

We need an army of public health workers to conduct activities like testing and contact tracing to stop the spread of COVID-19 and reopen the economy. Let’s use and boost programs like @AmeriCorps that have the infrastructure and are ready for action. https://t.co/oWme5CsNHU

You might have heard the recent news reports that @USPS is in urgent need of relief. I am fighting to make sure that Congress provides them the resources they need to continue serving ALL areas of Minnesota through this crisis. It's the right thing to do. https://t.co/aLFvH5anfx
Wonderful to talk to you @Sbartley22. Listen in on @899KMOJ next week to hear the conversation. https://t.co/QvKQYGt7cI
I’m dedicated to giving Minnesotans like Bob a voice in Washington – and to putting a stop to wasted taxpayer dollars, like IRS checks going to dead people.  https://t.co/xMSMF3pwgw
I couldn't agree more. That's why I've been fighting with @SenWarren to get $50 billion to child care providers because without these programs, we can't go back to work. https://t.co/g4adXc0aYY

This is truly unbelievable. Rolling back Title IX rules (in the midst of a pandemic no less) is a reckless decision that is only going to end up hurting survivors of sexual assault and removing important protections for a fair process on college campuses across the country. https://t.co/07OAswGL4r
.@RadioDaveLee mentioned this to me today. I tracked down the video, and I’m so glad that health care workers are being shown how much they are appreciated. https://t.co/RFebA3ObTk

It’s been a tough time out there for health care workers. We cannot say thank you enough to nurses for all the work they do day-in and day-out to keep us safe. On this #NationalNursesDay we celebrate true heroes and I'll keep fighting to ensure they get the resources they need. https://t.co/aEYYFwwlga

Native women are murdered at a rate of 10x the national average on some reservations. Today on the National Day of Awareness for Missing & Murdered Indigenous Women & Girls, I’m calling on the Senate to reauthorize #VAWA.

When we reopen the economy, it needs to be done safely. We need to immediately acquire ample testing supplies so that people can go back to work without compromising their health. 

I discussed this and COVID-19 funding on @business yesterday. https://t.co/JxqJ81WxQc

Good to see that Treasury heeded my call to get these funds out the door, but this is just a start. Treasury should disburse all $8 billion to Tribal governments immediately—Tribes have already had to wait too long. I’ll continue fighting to make sure Tribes get their fair share. https://t.co/iuA2ny9Zam

I loved this thread and thanks for sharing Em and Doug’s story. Let’s all make sure to look out for each other during this difficult time and thank our friends at @USPS for helping make stories like this happen. https://t.co/SAgjYn90n4

May is #MentalHealthMonth, and especially now we need to recognize the importance of mental health on our overall well-being. We need legislation to expand mental health services—and I will continue to fight for these important resources, because mental health is health.
Here’s a photo of me from junior high. Growing up I was lucky to have some great teachers who made a real impact on my life, and who I still remember to this day. https://t.co/cZgPVsnTvG
May 2 - still the same. https://t.co/OXBpraWwW4

We know that the road to reopening is paved with a strong public health response. People are not going to go out shopping or to a restaurant unless they know they are going to be safe there. 
 
I talked about the path forward with fighting COVID-19 on @MSNBC last night. https://t.co/LIGM6RR2ey

When I can, I go out early for a walk before getting to work. Report from this morning: I saw a little eastern screech owl and a pair of big barred owls, resting up while the world walked by. Look up people, it’s amazing what you’ll see. @audubonsociety
Currently coloring my own hair. Who else is doing it DIY right now? If my hair is purple on Monday, it’s on me.

For the past month, I’ve been fighting to make sure the money that Congress allocated to Tribal governments is distributed to them quickly by the Trump administration. I talked with Minnesota Native News about this and the challenges ahead. https://t.co/UWki5vyh4I

This is important. 

Workers on the front lines of this pandemic have been in desperate need for more PPE, testing kits and critical medical supplies. We need to put the full weight of the government behind this to get it done. https://t.co/UCpeAbu0dd

Thanks, Elizabeth. Folks are going to need safe, affordable, and reliable care for their children when it’s safe to return to work. With this funding, we can make sure that care is still there. https://t.co/qfiRQ90T67

Yesterday my day started with a call with @GovTimWalz and ended with a constituent briefing with @RepAngieCraig talking small business.

All in all, I talked with well over 100 Minnesotans, drank countless cups of tea, and did all I could to help solve problems for Minnesotans.

Archie and I have been married for 35 years, and we get it: no one's perfect. 

Here’s what this looks like as we #StayAtHome: Archie deals with a mouse that snuck into our trash compactor. I unload the dishes. Sometimes we have a standoff over who cleans the kitchen: like today.

Thank you so much for working on this with me Senator.

States and cities are leading the fight against COVID-19, and they should get the same tax credits as businesses to help provide paid leave to their employees. https://t.co/d6vTPbujrE

This is great news and an important win for Tribal Governments. The administration must deliver the allocated aid we promised to Tribes without delay. 

https://t.co/4Lovnbs2ut

If you have questions you’d like answered, email them to rsvp@smith.senate.gov. https://t.co/SdhUFPU6hd

I’m going to be talking with @RepAngieCraig and the Minnesota heads of SBA and DEED tomorrow to answer your questions about coronavirus relief for small businesses. 

If you have any questions you’d like answered, email them to rsvp@smith.senate.gov. https://t.co/JtrCKCimit

Tribal governments should not need to be banging on the door of the U.S. Treasury to get the money Congress has already allocated for them. Period. 

I’m going to keep pushing until Tribes get the money they rightfully deserve. 

https://t.co/v3LUeNhl5L

BREAKING: Treasury Dept. heeded my bipartisan call w/ @SenJohnBarrasso to make rural hospitals eligible for #PaycheckProtectionProgram. Too many are struggling during this pandemic—even forced to lay off workers while facing surge in patients. PPP will provide them with relief.

I penned an op-ed about what we've done and what we need to do to contain the virus and get families and businesses back on their feet. Minnesotans are resilient. Together, we will build back better and build back stronger. https://t.co/R8GIyGa8Pq

I’m glad that Congress has passed another bill to help small businesses stay afloat. But there’s a lot more we have to do. We need funding for rural hospitals & rural communities so they can provide basic services like health care delivery & public safety. https://t.co/aC3hfmlwA2

Congress created $8B Emergency Tribal Relief Fund to help Tribal governments respond to COVID-19. Today, the Trump Admin said they will distribute this $ in part to Alaska Native corporations that are NOT Tribal gov’ts. This betrays Congressional intent & betrays Tribal nations. https://t.co/xhvbJQmHLg

Childcare providers are some of our country's greatest heroes in the fight against COVID-19. They're enabling health care workers and other essential employees w/ kids to go to work. If we want to fight this virus, we need to support the childcare system. https://t.co/C4PVNpwF3B

If you are experiencing domestic violence during the coronavirus stay-at home-order, please know that help is available. Call @CornerstoneMN's Day One hotline at 1-866-223-1111 or @strongheartsdv's hotline at 1−844-762-8483. https://t.co/Pud2Gkcd9p

State and federal partners and health care systems working together for public health and our economy—MN is showing how we do that. When I fought for $25B to ramp up testing, it was to help support work like this. Thank you @GovTimWalz and all the Minnesota leaders in this fight. https://t.co/zBnYObhCkP

Minnesotans have a lot to be proud of on the 50th anniversary of #EarthDay—we’re leaders in renewable energy and one of the most bike friendly states. Today, & every day, we need to protect our planet so that future generations can enjoy the beautiful state that we know and love. https://t.co/RaPxKhI0FZ

UPDATE: Today I helped the Senate pass a relief package which will provide $370B in emergency loans and grants for hard-hit small businesses in MN & across the country. It also targets $75B to help hospitals handle the surge in infections and $25B to improve testing capabilities.

This weekend I told @CNN's @FWhitfield that many small businesses have weeks, not months, to survive an emergency like this pandemic. We need to get $ to them fast, along with help for hospitals & state & local governments, plus better testing. More here: https://t.co/NmJ6iEtEPS

We need to get additional help to hospitals in small towns & rural areas. @SenJohnBarrasso & I are introducing bipartisan bill that would make rural hospitals eligible for the Paycheck Protection Program created through CARES Act. Will push to get it in next legislative package.

Nope, not an accurate characterization, @WSJopinion. And good news! Trump heard the Democrats & is moving in our direction, for the good of small business, hospitals, & improved testing. Bipartisan compromise adds up to better legislation. Nice try though! https://t.co/TaFQnN9mDw
I’m mad too Angus. I’ll be less mad if they move forward with our plan for comprehensive testing. https://t.co/HKGPGs50F3

In the next relief package we need:

-State & local funding
-Loans for small businesses
-Hospital infrastructure and protective gear
-Testing kit availability 

I talked about my plan for how to get these resources for Minnesotans on @FOX9: https://t.co/uolqvvfj9X

Banks are ripping off federal payments Minnesotans need to help pay for things like formula & rent. I’m fighting to put a stop to this unfair practice w/ @SenKamalaHarris. Americans’ direct assistance payments should be exempt from private debt collection. https://t.co/8OB3k2rSnY

This shouldn’t need clarification, yet it bears repeating for the Trump Admin: Congress fought for $8 billion to help Tribal gov'ts continue to provide essential services for Native people during this pandemic, and we intended that these resources would go only to helping Tribes.

I agree with Democrats, Marco Rubio and the U.S. Chamber—we should fix the small business program so it works better. And we should help hospitals and support state and local services like firefighters and police—immediately. https://t.co/2jzSKhxKId
